nodes.bodyText:
s/Jkube/JKube/
Please, describe the purpose of this example, e.g. "This is a minimal getting started project with the basics to start using Eclipse JKube..."

Let's use some consistent declarative naming "Eclipse JKube Maven :: Sample :: Hello World"
(
  
    
      jkube/quickstarts/maven/spring-boot/pom.xml
    
    
         Line 33
      in
      24b3e7e
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <name>Eclipse JKube Maven :: Sample :: Spring Boot Web</name> 
        
    
  

)

nodes.bodyText: This test suite tests nothing, please add a valid test or remove the test suite completely.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@
+/**

+ * which is available at:

+package org.eclipse.jkube.sample.helloworld;
+
+import junit.framework.Test;
+import junit.framework.TestCase;
+import junit.framework.TestSuite;
+
+/**
+ * Unit test for simple App.
+ */
+public class AppTest
+    extends TestCase
+{
+    /**
+     * Create the test case
+     *
+     * @param testName name of the test case
+     */
+    public AppTest( String testName )
+    {
+        super( testName );
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * @return the suite of tests being tested
+     */
+    public static Test suite()
+    {
+        return new TestSuite( AppTest.class );
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Rigourous Test :-)
+     */
+    public void testApp()
+    {
+        assertTrue( true );
